artefact.overview: You need a register with HMRC to put duty-suspended excise goods in a warehouse or buy and store duty-suspended excise goods already in a warehouse
artefact.licence_short_description: Register with HMRC to put duty-suspended excise goods in a warehouse or buy and store duty-suspended excise goods already in a warehouse.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you intend to deposit  duty-suspended excise goods that you own in an excise warehouse or you intend to buy and store duty-suspended excise goods that are already held in an excise warehouse, you must be registered and approved by [HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC)](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/ "HM Revenue & Customs"){:rel="external"} as a Registered Owner unless:

* you aren't a revenue trader
* you are an authorised excise warehousekeeper storing your own goods in your own excise warehouse
* the goods are UK duty-paid excise goods that are being warehoused for export under the [excise duty drawback scheme](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageExcise_ShowContent&propertyType=document&id=HMCE_PROD1_031924 "excise duty drawback scheme"){:rel="external"}
* the goods are wine or made-wine
* the goods are hydrocarbon oil, bioethanol or special energy product
* you are a non-UK based owner and have appointed a duty representative to act on your behalf

##How to apply

Owners requiring registration must apply on [form EX60](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageExcise_Forms&propertyType=document&id=HMCE_PROD1_026085 "form EX60"){:rel="external"} and duty representatives intending to act on behalf of overseas owners must apply on [form EX64.](http://search2.hmrc.gov.uk/kb5/hmrc/forms/view.page?record=mYZd7XkAh7U&formId=584 "form EX64"){:rel="external"} If the business is a partnership, you must also complete form [Excise 102.](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageExcise_Forms&propertyType=document&id=HMCE_PROD1_030257 "Excise 102"){:rel="external"} 

HMRC will only consider applications from owners and duty representatives who are based in the UK.

Prior to acting for an overseas owner, a duty representative must carry out checks to make sure the owner does not have a business establishment or fixed address in the UK.

When applying for registration, you must allow a minimum of 30 working days for your application to be processed. You are also required to send an up to date business plan with your application.

Other details you must disclose include:

* any unspent convictions (other than minor motoring offences) that you or other key personnel in the business have
* any previous registrations as an owner or duty representative, including your previous registration number, name and address

All applicants will receive a pre-approval visit from HMRC in order to determine whether or not they are suitable for approval.

If your application is accepted and approval is granted, you will be issued with a certificate of registration.

You will only be permitted to hold dutiable goods of the class or description specified on your certificate of registration.

You must give the excise warehousekeeper a full copy of your certificate of registration before depositing or buying dutiable goods in their excise warehouse.

##Penalties and fines

%If you fail to register or comply with any conditions of your approval, you may be fined and your goods may be forfeited.%

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
